docs.data_centre_acquisition_software: Generic seismic freeware with in-house scripting

Microsoft Access and Excel, parameterisation tools (Boxer, Bakun & Wentworth, MEEP), Geographical Information Systems (ESRI ArcMap and QGIS). Web front-end in-house developed using an AMP environment (Apache, MySQL and PHP). Only open standard libraries and open file formats are used. Data browsing has been tested on all major platform, no external (plugins) required on modern browsers. An in-house developed software is used for generating SVG interactive maps, which is under an open source licence and well documented.

docs.data_centre_hardware: Monitoring room, parallel computers, data storage

docs.data_centre_acquisition_software: Automatic real-time analysis, quality check, archive, data completion and distribution freely available or home-grown.
docs.data_centre_hardware: Monitoring room with terminals, video walls, storage area network and backup power system in Rome. The main components are mirrored in Grottaminarda (South Italy).
docs.data_organization: : Archive is in SDS (file system), organized in miniseed daily files per component. Metadata (station information) and paramentric data (event data) are stored and dealt with a MySQL database.
docs.dc_connectivity_protocols: SeedLink, Earthworm and Nanometrics. Arclink protocol is in use for archived data
